_comment: FY2024 Survey Answer Schema - stores only answers, questions are in template
_savings: ~67% space reduction vs full markdown files

engagement_grid._comment: G1: Who was engaged and how

engagement_descriptions.barriers_people_who_use_drugs: Our working group did not include any users, but we have expanded to family member(s) with shared experience. Our Fishing Parntership and Aids Support Group has been helpful in this area.

disparities_assessment.other_methods: Interviews with existng service providers with our committee addressed the needs of our community and the lower cape region. Our community is mostly older and white, however we are trying to reach out to workers and school age populations who have limited access to services. additionally the Health Division did a Public Health Communtiy Assessment with outer and lower cape communities of Orleans, Harwich, and Brewster and this information will be helpful moving forward. We have also provided funds for barriers to services such as travel expenses and home expenses .

behavioral_health_assessment._comment: G3: How behavioral health needs were assessed
behavioral_health_assessment.other_methods: Interviews and presentations with service providers such as outer cape health, the Fishing partnership, Aids Support Group and Duffy Health Center.
behavioral_health_assessment.barriers: I dont feel we encountered any large barriers to assessing needs, however the CHNA we conducted in summer 2024 has been very informative

existing_programs._comment: G4: Programs/services to leverage (mostly empty in this example)
programs: Human Services Connection to Care/ close loop referral program

practices.name: Support Harm Reduction/Narcan trainings and access

planning.process: Our municipality conducted its own planning process. We engaged in shared planning with other municipalities.

how_spent: Support the work of Emergency Medical Systems, including peer support specialists and post-overdose response teams, to connect individuals to trauma-informed treatment recovery support, harm reduction services, primary healthcare, or other appropriate services following an opioid overdose or other opioid-related adverse event

Support school-based services related to OUD, such as school-based contacts that parents can engage with to seek immediate treatment services for their child; and support prevention, intervention, treatment, and recovery programs focused on young people. This should include alternatives to suspension or interaction with school resource officers such as restorative justice approaches

Fund services or training to encourage early identification and intervention for families, children, or adolescents who may be struggling with use of drugs or mental health conditions, including peer-based programs and Youth Mental Health First Aid. Training programs may target families, caregivers, school staff, peers, neighbors, health or human services professionals, or other in contact with children or adolescents.
Provide training and education regarding naloxone and other drugs that treat overdoses

Promote efforts to train health care providers, students, peer recovery coaches, recovery outreach specialists, or other professionals that provide care to persons who use opioids or persons with OUD in crisis training and harm reduction strategies
Provide outreach and services for people who use drugs and are not yet in treatment, including services that build relationships with and support for people with OUD

criminal_justice.barriers: Not seen as a primary issue in our community

pregnant_parenting.barriers: Not sure of the needs in this area

additional_comments.general: This programhas allowed us to hire a part time recovery coach to be in our community on a regular basis and work cooperatively with town staff, EMT,social workers etc to identify residents with SUD, families, etc.
additional_comments.unmet_needs: We are aware that the limited amount of funding and the eventual ending of funding will require us to work regionally to provide services as needed across the lower cape. We hope the work we are doing now will provide a framework and connections moving forward.
